availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Watson Foster (Evansville, Indiana, attorney and colonel (U.S.A.))

body.p: Evansville, Indiana, attorney and soldier. Indiana native. Son of George Foster and M.W Foster. Married to Mary P. Foster. Resident in Vanderburgh County, Indiana in 1850. Graduated from Indiana State University in 1855. Attended Harvard Law School. Attorney in Evansville, Indiana in 1860. Employed Louisa Lickmeyer in Evansville, Indiana in 1860. Joined United States Army as Major in 1861. Served in 65th Indiana Volunteer Regiment (U.S.A.) as Colonel from August 24, 1862 to March 10, 1864. Resigned for health reasons. Re-entered as Colonel of 136th Indiana Volunteer Regiment (U.S.A.) and resigned on August 29, 1864. United States Secretary of State from June 29, 1892 to February 23, 1893.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Vanderburgh County, Evansville, p. 419. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Vanderburgh County, Pigeon War 4, p. 43-44. Frederick H. Dyer, A Compendium of the War of the Rebellion, Volume 1 (Des Moines: The Dyer Publishing Company, 1908), 1143. Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Indiana: Indiana Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 2 (Indianapolis: W.R. Holloway, State Printer, 1865), 598. Office of the Historian, Foreign Service Institute, United States Department of the State, “Biographies of Secretary of the State: John Watson Foster (1836-1917),” https://history.state.gov/departmenthistory/people/foster-john-watson.
